POSTGRES_PASSWORD.short: Sets the password for the default user

POSTGRES_USER.short: The username for the default user. Defaults to `postgres`

POSTGRES_DB.short: The default database name. Defaults to the value of `POSTGRES_USER`

MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME.short: The username for the default superuser

MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD.short: The password for the default superuser

ME_CONFIG_MONGODB_ENABLE_ADMIN.short: Enable admin access to all databases. Send strings: `"true"` or `"false"`

ME_CONFIG_MONGODB_SERVER.short: MongoDB container name. Use comma delimited list of host names for replica sets.

ME_CONFIG_REQUEST_SIZE.short: Maximum payload size. CRUD operations above this size will fail in [body-parser](https://www.npmjs.com/package/body-parser).

ME_CONFIG_SITE_BASEURL.short: Set the baseUrl to ease mounting at a subdirectory. Remember to include a leading and trailing slash.

ME_CONFIG_SITE_COOKIESECRET.short: String used by [cookie-parser middleware](https://www.npmjs.com/package/cookie-parser) to sign cookies.

ME_CONFIG_SITE_SESSIONSECRET.short: String used to sign the session ID cookie by [express-session middleware](https://www.npmjs.com/package/express-session).

NGROK_AUTH.short: Authentication key for your Ngrok account. This is needed for custom subdomains, custom domains, and HTTP authentication

NGROK_SUBDOMAIN.short: Name of the custom subdomain to use for your tunnel. You must also provide the authentication token.

NGROK_PORT.short: Port to expose (defaults to `80` for `HTTP` protocol). If the server is non-local, the hostname can also be specified, e.g. `192.168.0.102:80`
